issues: Major semantic conflict: env_local_scale claims 'evergreen forest' but all land cover data indicates grassland ecosystem
Coordinate displacement: 4.49 km distance between asserted coordinates and geocoded location from 'USA: Utah, Onaqui'
Environmental hierarchy inconsistency: terrestrial biome → evergreen forest → soil does not align with grassland land cover
Missing ecosystem_subtype value (currently 'Unclassified') despite rich environmental context available
Land cover data shows consistent grassland classification across multiple systems but conflicts with asserted forest environment
Collection date (2016-07-28) in summer aligns well with temperature (29°C) and dry conditions (4.8% water content)
Elevation discrepancy: 10m difference between asserted (1886m) and geospatial lookup (1896m) is acceptable
recommendations: CRITICAL: Verify and correct env_local_scale - change from 'evergreen forest' to grassland-appropriate term like ENVO:00000106 (grassland area)
Review coordinate accuracy - consider using geocoded coordinates (40.2106006, -112.5610339) if more representative of actual sampling location
Update ecosystem_subtype from 'Unclassified' to more specific term like 'Grassland' or 'Semi-arid grassland'
Cross-reference sampling protocols to confirm environmental context - was sample actually from forest edge transitioning to grassland?
Consider adding land_use or habitat_description field to capture the grassland nature of the sampling site
Validate env_local_scale against field notes or site photos to resolve forest vs grassland discrepancy
Use regosol soil type information from enrichment to enhance soil characterization fields
